intro: Amsinckia parshii, commonly known as the Parshii fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, lobed leaves and produces a distinctive, ridged stem. Amsinckia parshii is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
